messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: A pest is an animal that can hurt people or plants.

Small animals live in many cities and towns.
We see birds.
We see squirrels.
We see mice.
We see bugs.

But in the last few years, the news has many stories.
The stories say wild animals come into cities more and more.

People saw bears in Vancouver parks.
People saw leopards on Mumbai streets.
People saw wild pigs in Berlin gardens.

What happens when big animals come into our cities?
Are they welcome?
Or are they a danger or a pest?
Feedback received: Grade 3/10 - FAIL

It is for an animal that can hurt people or plants.

Small animals live in many cities and towns. We see birds. We see squirrels. We see mice. We see insects.

In the last few years, the world's press has many reports. The reports say wild animals come into cities more and more.

People saw bears in Vancouver parks. People saw leopards on Mumbai streets. People saw wild pigs in Berlin gardens.

What happens when big animals come into our cities? Are they welcome or a danger? Or are they a pest?
Feedback received: Grade 3/10 - FAIL

Many small animals live in cities.

But now wild animals come more and more into cities.  
People see bears in Vancouver parks.  
They see leopards on Mumbai streets.  
They see wild pigs in Berlin gardens.  
What happens when big animals come into cities?  
Are they a danger or a pest?  
Or are they welcome?
Feedback received: Grade 3/10 - FAIL
